bugs

Class Recognizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • bugs.Recognizer

  • public class Recognizer
extends java.lang.Object
    This class consists of a number of methods that "recognize" strings composed of Tokens that follow the indicated grammar rules for each method.

    Each method may have one of three outcomes:

    • The method may succeed, returning true and consuming the tokens that make up that particular nonterminal.
    • The method may fail, returning false and not consuming any tokens.
    • (Some methods only) The method may determine that an unrecoverable error has occurred and throw a SyntaxException
      • .
    Version:
    February 2015
    Author:
    Anders Schneider

    • Method Detail

      • isExpression

        public boolean isExpression()
        Tries to recognize an <expression>. 
        <expression> ::= <arithmetic expression> { <comparator> <arithmetic expression> }
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if the comparator is present but not followed by a valid <arithmetic expression>.
        Returns:
        true if an expression is recognized.

      • isArithmeticExpression

        public boolean isArithmeticExpression()
        Tries to recognize an <arithmetic expression>. 
        <arithmetic expression> ::= [ <add operator> ] <term> { <add_operator> <term> }
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if the add_operator is present but not followed by a valid <term>.
        Returns:
        true if an arithmetic expression is recognized.

      • isTerm

        public boolean isTerm()
        Tries to recognize a <term>. 
        <term> ::= <factor> { <multiply_operator> <term>}
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if the multiply_operator is present but not followed by a valid <term>.
        Returns:
        true if a term is recognized.

      • isFactor

        public boolean isFactor()
        Tries to recognize a <factor>. 
        <factor> ::= <name> "." <name>
           | <name> "(" <parameter list> ")"
           | <name>
           | <number>
           | "(" <expression> ")"
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if the opening parenthesis is present but not followed by a valid <expression> and a closing parenthesis.
        Returns:
        true if a factor is recognized.

      • isParameterList

        public boolean isParameterList()
        Tries to recognize a <parameter list>. 
        <parameter list> ::= "(" [ <expression> { "," <expression> } ] ")"
        Returns:
        true if a parameter list is recognized.

      • isAddOperator

        public boolean isAddOperator()
        Tries to recognize an <add_operator>. 
        <add_operator> ::= "+" | "-"
        Returns:
        true if an addop is recognized.

      • isMultiplyOperator

        public boolean isMultiplyOperator()
        Tries to recognize a <multiply_operator>. 
        <multiply_operator> ::= "*" | "/"
        Returns:
        true if a multiply_operator is recognized.

      • isVariable

        public boolean isVariable()
        Tries to recognize a <variable>. 
        <variable> ::= <NAME>
        Returns:
        true if a variable is recognized.

      • isAction

        public boolean isAction()
        Tries to recognize an <action>. 
        <action> ::= <move action>
           | <moveto action>
           | <turn action>
           | <turnto action>
           | <line action>
        Returns:
        true if an action is recognized.

      • isAllbugsCode

        public boolean isAllbugsCode()
        Tries to recognize an <allbugs code>. 
        <allbugs code> ::= "Allbugs" "{" <eol>
                       { <var declaration> }
                       { <function definition> }
                  "}" <eol>
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if the 'Allbugs' is not followed by a "{", or if there is no eol after the first "{", or if the final "}" is not present, or if there is an error with the final eol of the allbugs code.
        Returns:
        true if an allbugs code is recognized.

      • isAssignmentStatement

        public boolean isAssignmentStatement()
        Tries to recognize a <assignment statement>. 
        <assignment statement> ::= <variable> "=" <expression> <eol>
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if the variable is is present but not followed by a "=", or if the "=" is not followed by a valid <expression>, or if the <expression> is not followed by a valid <eol>.
        Returns:
        true if an assignment statement is recognized.

      • isBlock

        public boolean isBlock()
        Tries to recognize a <block>. 
        <block> ::= "{" <eol> { <command> } "}" <eol>
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if the '{' is not followed by an eol, or if a "}" or appropriate eol is not included.
        Returns:
        true if a block is recognized.

      • isBugDefinition

        public boolean isBugDefinition()
        Tries to recognize a <bug definition>. 
        <bug definition> ::= "Bug" <NAME> "{" <eol>
                       { <var declaration> }
                       [ <initialization block> ]
                       <command>
                       { <command> }
                       { <function definition> }
                  "}" <eol>
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if the 'Bug' is not followed by a valid name, or if the first "{" is not present, or if there is no eol after the first "{", or if the necessary command does not appear where it should, or if the final "}" is not present, or if there is an error with the final eol of the definition.
        Returns:
        true if a Bug definition is recognized.

      • isColorStatement

        public boolean isColorStatement()
        Tries to recognize a <color statement>. 
        <color statement> ::= "color" <KEYWORD> <eol>
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if the 'color' is not followed by a keyword, or if the keyword is not followed by an eol.
        Returns:
        true if a color statement is recognized.

      • isCommand

        public boolean isCommand()
        Tries to recognize a <command>. 
        <command> ::= <action> | <statement>
        Returns:
        true if a command is recognized.

      • isComparator

        public boolean isComparator()
        Tries to recognize a <comparator>. 
        <comparator> ::= <"<"> | <"<="> | <"="> | <"!="> | <">="> | <">">
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if the "!" is present but not followed by "=".
        Returns:
        true if a comparator is recognized.

      • isDoStatement

        public boolean isDoStatement()
        Tries to recognize a <do statement>. 
        <do statement> ::= "do" <variable> [ <parameter list> ] <eol>
        Returns:
        true if a do statement is recognized.

      • isEol

        public boolean isEol()
        Tries to recognize an <eol>. 
        <eol> ::= <EOL> { <EOL> }
        Returns:
        true if an eol is recognized.

      • isExitIfStatement

        public boolean isExitIfStatement()
        Tries to recognize an <exit if statement>. 
        <exit if statement> ::= "exit" "if" <expression> <eol>
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if the "exit" is is present but not followed by an "if", or if the "if" is not followed by a valid <expression>, or if the <expression> is not followed by a valid <eol>.
        Returns:
        true if an exit if statement is recognized.

      • isFunctionCall

        public boolean isFunctionCall()
        Tries to recognize a <function call>. 
        <function call> ::= <NAME> <parameter list>
        Returns:
        true if a do statement is recognized.

      • isFunctionDefinition

        public boolean isFunctionDefinition()
        Tries to recognize a <function definition>. 
        <function definition> ::= "define" <NAME> [ "using" <variable> { "," <variable> } ] <block>
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if the "define" is present but not followed by a valid <NAME> or if one of the variables has an error.
        Returns:
        true if a function definition is recognized.

      • isInitializationBlock

        public boolean isInitializationBlock()
        Tries to recognize an <initialization block>. 
        <initialization block> ::= "initially" <block>
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if the "initially" is present but not followed by a valid <block>
        Returns:
        true if an initialization block is recognized.

      • isLineAction

        public boolean isLineAction()
        Tries to recognize a <line action>. 
        <line action> ::= "line" <expression> "," <expression> "," <expression> "," <expression> <eol>
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if the "line" is present but any of the following <expression>s or ","s are not valid.
        Returns:
        true if a line action is recognized.

      • isLoopStatement

        public boolean isLoopStatement()
        Tries to recognize a <loop statement>. 
        <loop statement> ::= "loop" <block>
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if the "loop" is present but not followed by a valid <block>
        Returns:
        true if a loop statement is recognized.

      • isMoveAction

        public boolean isMoveAction()
        Tries to recognize a <move action>. 
        <move action> ::= "move" <expression> <eol>
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if the "move" is present but not followed by a valid <expression>, or the <expression> is not followed by an eol.
        Returns:
        true if a move action is recognized.

      • isMoveToAction

        public boolean isMoveToAction()
        Tries to recognize a <moveto action>. 
        <move action> ::= "moveto" <expression> "," <expression> <eol>
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if the "moveto" is present but not followed by a valid <expression>, or the <expression> is not followed by a ",", valid <expression>, and then a valid <eol>.
        Returns:
        true if a move action is recognized.

      • isProgram

        public boolean isProgram()
        Tries to recognize a <program>. 
        <program> ::= [ <allbugs code> ] <bug definition> { <bug definition> }
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if there is no valid <bug definition>.
        Returns:
        true if a program is recognized.

      • isReturnStatement

        public boolean isReturnStatement()
        Tries to recognize a <return statement>. 
        <return statement> ::= "return" <expression> <eol>
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if the "return" is is present but not followed by a valid <expression>, or if the <expression> is not followed by a valid <eol>.
        Returns:
        true if a return statement is recognized.

      • isStatement

        public boolean isStatement()
        Tries to recognize as <statement>. 
        <action> ::= <assignment statement>
           | <loop statement>
           | <exit if statement>
           | <switch statement>
           | <return statement>
           | <do statement>
           | <color statement>
        Returns:
        true if a statement is recognized.

      • isSwitchStatement

        public boolean isSwitchStatement()
        Tries to recognize a <switch statement>. 
        <switch statement> ::= "switch" "{" <eol>
                       { "case" <expression> <eol>
                           { <command> } }
                  "}" <eol>
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if the "switch" is not followed by a "{", or if there is no eol after the first "{", or if there is no valid expression after "case", or if there is no valid eol following the expression, or if the final "}" is not present, or if there is an error with the final eol of the statement.
        Returns:
        true if a switch statement is recognized.

      • isTurnAction

        public boolean isTurnAction()
        Tries to recognize a <turn action>. 
        <turn action> ::= "turn" <expression> <eol>
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if the "turn" is present but not followed by a valid <expression>, or the <expression> is not followed by an eol.
        Returns:
        true if a turn action is recognized.

      • isTurnToAction

        public boolean isTurnToAction()
        Tries to recognize a <turnto action>. 
        <turn action> ::= "turnto" <expression> <eol>
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if the "turnto" is present but not followed by a valid <expression>, or the <expression> is not followed by an eol.
        Returns:
        true if a turnto action is recognized.

      • isVarDeclaration

        public boolean isVarDeclaration()
        Tries to recognize a <var declaration>. 
        <var declaration> ::= "var" <NAME> { "," <NAME> } <eol>
        A SyntaxException will be thrown if the "var" is present but not followed by a valid <NAME>, or a "," is present but not followed by a valid <NAME>, or there is no valid eol at the end.
        Returns:
        true if a var declaration is recognized.

      • symbol

        boolean symbol(java.lang.String expectedSymbol)
        Tests whether the next token is the expected symbol. If it is, the token is consumed, otherwise it is not.
        Parameters:
        expectedSymbol - The String value of the token we expect to encounter next.
        Returns:
        true if the next token is the expected symbol.

      • nextTokenMatches

        boolean nextTokenMatches(Token.Type type)
        Tests whether the next token has the expected type. If it does, the token is consumed, otherwise it is not. This method would normally be used only when the token's value is not relevant.
        Parameters:
        type - The expected type of the next token.
        Returns:
        true if the next token has the expected type.

      • nextTokenMatches

        boolean nextTokenMatches(Token.Type type,
                         java.lang.String value)
        Tests whether the next token has the expected type and value. If it does, the token is consumed, otherwise it is not. This method would normally be used when the token's value is important.
        Parameters:
        type - The expected type of the next token.
        value - The expected value of the next token; must not be null.
        Returns:
        true if the next token has the expected type.

      • nextToken

        Token nextToken()
        Returns the next Token.
        Returns:
        The next Token.

      • pushBack

        void pushBack()
        Returns the most recent Token to the tokenizer.
